articles.author: Andrew Mills, Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Negotiators were to meet in the Qatari capital Doha again on Friday in an effort to hammer out a Gaza ceasefire agreement as Israel continued to slam targets in the Palestinian enclave.
articles.title: Gaza ceasefire negotiations extend another day as death toll exceeds 40,000

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Anger over the brutal rape and murder of a doctor in eastern India showed no signs of dying down on Friday, as medics called for the largest shutdown of hospital services in recent times, and political parties geared up for protests.
articles.title: Indian doctors call for nationwide shutdown after brutal rape of medic

articles.author: Panu Wongcha-Um, Martin Petty
articles.description: Political newcomer Paetongtarn Shinawatra will bid to become Thailand's youngest premier in a crunch parliamentary vote on Friday, a day after being thrust into the spotlight and an unrelenting power struggle between the country's warring elites.
articles.title: Baptism of fire awaits Paetongtarn as Thailand gears up for PM vote

articles.author: Dan Peleschuk
articles.description: After a Russian missile tore through Ukraine's largest children's hospital last month, fundraiser Yevhen Vember sprang into action, marshalling more than $9 million for speedy repairs.
articles.title: War-hit Kyiv hospital is scrutinised over reconstruction effort

articles.author: Nandita Bose
articles.description: President Joe Biden on Friday will designate a national monument to commemorate a 1908 race riot in Springfield, Illinois, that left several people dead, hundreds injured and destroyed dozens of Black-owned businesses and homes.
articles.title: Biden will designate 1908 Springfield race riot site as national monument

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A Russian parliamentary deputy said on Friday that the Western-backed Ukrainian incursion has brought the world close to an all-out global war, Russia's RIA news agency reported.
articles.title: Russian MP says Ukrainian incursion could lead to global war, RIA reports

articles.author: Kate Lamb
articles.description: Indonesian President Joko Widodo highlighted his economic, infrastructure and development successes in his final state of nation address on Friday, delivered months before he steps down after a decade as head of Southeast Asia's biggest economy.
articles.title: Indonesia president hails economic, infrastructure successes in final state of nation

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Immigration tops the list of issues that Britons consider most important for the first time since 2016 - when Britain voted to leave the European Union - following riots this month targeting Muslims and migrants, pollster Ipsos said on Friday.
articles.title: Immigration biggest issue for Britons for first time since 2016, poll shows

articles.author: Ludwig Burger, Miranda Murray
articles.description: Far more diagnostic kits, treatments and vaccines need to be shipped to Africa to respond adequately to the outbreak of a new strain of the mpox virus there, an official of the Red Cross and Red Crescent humanitarian network said on Friday.
articles.title: IFRC says shortage of testing, vaccines hampers mpox response in Africa

articles.author: Sam Jahan, Mokammel Mridha
articles.description: Ducking as mortar fire exploded around them, Rohingya refugee Mustafa Kamal and his family narrowly escaped the attack by a rebel militia on their town in western Myanmar.
articles.title: Wounded and grieving, Rohingya flee deadly attacks in Myanmar
